alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 2:15PM PST until February 21 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Chewelah, Springdale-Hunters Road, Tiger, Eastport, Bonners Ferry, Colville, Athol, Orin-Rice Road, Fruitland, Metaline Falls, Flowery Trail Road, Priest River, Kettle Falls, Metaline, Deer Park, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Clark Fork, Sandpoint, Ione, Newport, and Northport. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Flash freeze conditions may occur with dropping temperatures and snowfall on cold roads.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
